alert.note: Alert for Adams; Buffalo; Dawson; Furnas; Gosper; Greeley; Hall; Howard; Kearney; Phelps; Sherman; Valley (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 25 at 3:10PM CST until December 26 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...WINTER STORM PEAKING THROUGH TONIGHT BUT CONTINUES INTO TUESDAY... ...BLIZZARD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 6 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions expected at times. For the Winter Storm Warning, pockets of lingering heavy snow expected, along with possible light icing from freezing drizzle especially late tonight into Tuesday morning within counties north and west of the Tri Cities. Additional snow accumulations mainly between 3 and 6 inches, most of which which fall through tonight. Northwest winds gusting 30 to 40 MPH into this evening, but decreasing to no more than 20 to 30 MPH most areas late tonight through Wednesday. * WHERE...Portions of central and south central Nebraska, including the Tri Cities. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, until midnight CST tonight. For the Winter Storm Warning, from midnight tonight to 6 AM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions for post-Christmas travel. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility before winds diminish. Visibilities may drop below 1/4 mile due to falling and blowing snow, mainly before midnight tonight. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Wind gusts will gradually drop under 35 MPH tonight, allowing the Blizzard Warning to be replaced by a Winter Storm Warning.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel extremely dangerous. Do not travel. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay in your vehicle.
